byline.contributor: Robert Gebeloff and Anna M. Phillips contributed reporting

abstract: Latest report cards for New York City schools show that only one quarter of high school students are prepared to succeed in post-secondary education; figures suggest that the city still has a long way to go to prepare students for successful experiences in college and beyond.
snippet: The latest A-through-F report cards for city schools shows that just one-quarter of high school students are prepared to succeed in post-secondary education.
lead_paragraph: The latest A-through-F report cards for city schools shows that just one-quarter of high school students are prepared to succeed in post-secondary education.

headline.main: College Readiness Is Lacking, City Reports Show
headline.seo: Just One-Quarter of New York City Students Are Ready for College, Reports Show
